Comet Punch.name: Comet Punch
Comet Punch.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

Comeuppance.name: Comeuppance
Comeuppance.desc: Deals damage to the last opposing Pokemon to hit the user with a physical or special attack this turn equal to 1.5 times the HP lost by the user from that attack, rounded down. If the user did not lose HP from that attack, this move deals 1 HP of damage instead. If that opposing Pokemon's position is no longer in use and there is another opposing Pokemon on the field, the damage is done to it instead. Only the last hit of a multi-hit attack is counted. Fails if the user was not hit by an opposing Pokemon's physical or special attack this turn.
Comeuppance.shortDesc: If hit by an attack, returns 1.5x damage.

Confide.name: Confide
Confide.desc: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.
Confide.shortDesc: Lowers the target's Sp. Atk by 1.

Confuse Ray.name: Confuse Ray
Confuse Ray.desc: Causes the target to become confused.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.desc: Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
Constrict.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1.

Continental Crush.name: Continental Crush
Continental Crush.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.
Continental Crush.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

Conversion.name: Conversion
Conversion.desc: The user's type changes to match the original type of the move in its first move slot. Fails if the user cannot change its type, or if the type is one of the user's current types.
Conversion.shortDesc: Changes user's type to match its first move.

Conversion 2.name: Conversion 2
Conversion 2.desc: The user's type changes to match a type that resists or is immune to the type of the last move used by the target, but not either of its current types. The determined type of the move is used rather than the original type. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the user cannot change its type, or if this move would only be able to select one of the user's current types.
Conversion 2.shortDesc: Changes user's type to resist target's last move.

Copycat.name: Copycat
Copycat.desc: The user uses the last move used by any Pokemon, including itself. Fails if no move has been used, or if the last move used was Assist, Baneful Bunker, Beak Blast, Behemoth Bash, Behemoth Blade, Belch, Bestow, Blazing Torque, Celebrate, Chatter, Circle Throw, Combat Torque, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Destiny Bond, Detect, Dragon Tail, Dynamax Cannon, Endure, Feint, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, Hold Hands, King's Shield, Magical Torque, Mat Block, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Noxious Torque, Protect, Rage Powder, Roar, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Spiky Shield, Spotlight, Struggle, Switcheroo, Thief, Transform, Trick, Whirlwind, or Wicked Torque.
Copycat.shortDesc: Uses the last move used in the battle.

Core Enforcer.name: Core Enforcer
Core Enforcer.desc: If the user moves after the target, the target's Ability is rendered ineffective as long as it remains active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under this effect. If the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero, this effect does not happen, and receiving the effect through Baton Pass ends the effect immediately.
Core Enforcer.shortDesc: Nullifies the foe(s) Ability if the foe(s) move first.

Corkscrew Crash.name: Corkscrew Crash
Corkscrew Crash.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.
Corkscrew Crash.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

Corrosive Gas.name: Corrosive Gas
Corrosive Gas.desc: The target loses its held item. This move cannot cause Pokemon with the Sticky Hold Ability to lose their held item or cause a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, a Silvally, a Zacian, or a Zamazenta to lose their Blue Orb, Red Orb, Griseous Orb, Plate, Drive, Memory, Rusted Sword, or Rusted Shield respectively. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.

Cosmic Power.name: Cosmic Power
Cosmic Power.desc: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.
Cosmic Power.shortDesc: Raises the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 1.

Cotton Guard.name: Cotton Guard
Cotton Guard.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 3 stages.

Cotton Spore.name: Cotton Spore
Cotton Spore.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.

Counter.name: Counter
Counter.desc: Deals damage to the last opposing Pokemon to hit the user with a physical attack this turn equal to twice the HP lost by the user from that attack. If the user did not lose HP from the attack, this move deals 1 HP of damage instead. If that opposing Pokemon's position is no longer in use and there is another opposing Pokemon on the field, the damage is done to it instead. Only the last hit of a multi-hit attack is counted. Fails if the user was not hit by an opposing Pokemon's physical attack this turn.
Counter.shortDesc: If hit by physical attack, returns double damage.

Court Change.name: Court Change
Court Change.desc: Switches the Mist, Light Screen, Reflect, Spikes, Safeguard, Tailwind, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, Water Pledge, Fire Pledge, Grass Pledge, Sticky Web, Aurora Veil, G-Max Steelsurge, G-Max Cannonade, G-Max Vine Lash, and G-Max Wildfire effects from the user's side to the opposing side and vice versa.
Court Change.shortDesc: Swaps user's field effects with the opposing side.

Covet.name: Covet
Covet.desc: If this attack was successful and the user has not fainted, it steals the target's held item if the user is not holding one. The target's item is not stolen if it is a Mail or Z-Crystal, or if the target is a Kyogre holding a Blue Orb, a Groudon holding a Red Orb, a Giratina holding a Griseous Orb, an Arceus holding a Plate, a Genesect holding a Drive, a Silvally holding a Memory, or a Pokemon that can Mega Evolve holding the Mega Stone for its species. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.
Covet.shortDesc: If the user has no item, it steals the target's.

Crabhammer.name: Crabhammer
Crabhammer.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

Crafty Shield.name: Crafty Shield
Crafty Shield.desc: The user and its party members are protected from non-damaging attacks made by other Pokemon, including allies, during this turn. Fails if the user moves last this turn or if this move is already in effect for the user's side.
Crafty Shield.shortDesc: Protects allies from Status moves this turn.

Cross Chop.name: Cross Chop
Cross Chop.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

Cross Poison.name: Cross Poison
Cross Poison.desc: Has a 10% chance to poison the target and a higher chance for a critical hit.
Cross Poison.shortDesc: High critical hit ratio. 10% chance to poison.

Crunch.name: Crunch
Crunch.desc: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Crunch.shortDesc: 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

Crush Claw.name: Crush Claw
Crush Claw.desc: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Crush Claw.shortDesc: 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

Crush Grip.name: Crush Grip
Crush Grip.desc: Power is equal to 120 * (target's current HP / target's maximum HP), rounded half down, but not less than 1.
Crush Grip.shortDesc: More power the more HP the target has left.

Curse.name: Curse
Curse.desc: If the user is not a Ghost type, lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage and raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage. If the user is a Ghost type, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down and even if it would cause fainting, in exchange for the target losing 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn while it is active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue to be affected. Fails if there is no target or if the target is already affected.
Curse.shortDesc: Curses if Ghost, else -1 Spe, +1 Atk, +1 Def.

Darkest Lariat.name: Darkest Lariat
Darkest Lariat.desc: Ignores the target's stat stage changes, including evasiveness.
Darkest Lariat.shortDesc: Ignores the target's stat stage changes.

Dark Pulse.name: Dark Pulse
Dark Pulse.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
Dark Pulse.shortDesc: 20% chance to make the target flinch.

Dark Void.name: Dark Void
Dark Void.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep. This move cannot be used successfully unless the user's current form, while considering Transform, is Darkrai.
Dark Void.shortDesc: Darkrai: Causes the foe(s) to fall asleep.

Dazzling Gleam.name: Dazzling Gleam
Dazzling Gleam.shortDesc: No additional effect. Hits adjacent foes.

Decorate.name: Decorate
Decorate.desc: Raises the target's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages.
Decorate.shortDesc: Raises the target's Attack and Sp. Atk by 2.

Defend Order.name: Defend Order
Defend Order.desc: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.
Defend Order.shortDesc: Raises the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 1.

Defense Curl.name: Defense Curl
Defense Curl.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage. As long as the user remains active, the power of the user's Ice Ball and Rollout will be doubled (this effect is not stackable).

Defog.name: Defog
Defog.desc: Lowers the target's evasiveness by 1 stage. If this move is successful and whether or not the target's evasiveness was affected, the effects of Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil, Safeguard, Mist, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the target's side, and the effects of Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the user's side. Ignores a target's substitute, although a substitute will still block the lowering of evasiveness. If there is a terrain active and this move is successful, the terrain will be cleared.
Defog.shortDesc: -1 evasion; clears terrain and hazards on both sides.

Destiny Bond.name: Destiny Bond
Destiny Bond.desc: Until the user's next move, if an opposing Pokemon's attack knocks the user out, that Pokemon faints as well, unless the attack was Doom Desire or Future Sight. Fails if the user used this move successfully as its last move, disregarding moves used through the Dancer Ability.
Destiny Bond.shortDesc: If an opponent knocks out the user, it also faints.

Detect.name: Detect
Detect.desc: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.
Detect.shortDesc: Prevents moves from affecting the user this turn.

Devastating Drake.name: Devastating Drake
Devastating Drake.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.
Devastating Drake.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

Diamond Storm.name: Diamond Storm
Diamond Storm.desc: Has a 50% chance to raise the user's Defense by 2 stages.
Diamond Storm.shortDesc: 50% chance to raise user's Defense by 2.

Dig.name: Dig
Dig.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Earthquake and Magnitude but takes double damage from them, and is also unaffected by weather. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

Disable.name: Disable
Disable.desc: For 4 turns, the target's last move used becomes disabled. Fails if one of the target's moves is already disabled, if the target has not made a move, if the target no longer knows the move, or if the move was a Max or G-Max Move.
Disable.shortDesc: For 4 turns, disables the target's last move used.

Disarming Voice.name: Disarming Voice
Disarming Voice.desc: This move does not check accuracy.
Disarming Voice.shortDesc: This move does not check accuracy. Hits foes.

Discharge.name: Discharge
Discharge.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Dire Claw.name: Dire Claw
Dire Claw.desc: Has a 50% chance to cause the target to either fall asleep, become poisoned, or become paralyzed.
Dire Claw.shortDesc: 50% chance to sleep, poison, or paralyze target.

Dive.name: Dive
Dive.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Surf and Whirlpool but takes double damage from them, and is also unaffected by weather. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

Dizzy Punch.name: Dizzy Punch
Dizzy Punch.desc: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

Doodle.name: Doodle
Doodle.desc: The user and its ally's Abilities change to match the target's Ability. Does not change Ability if the user's or its ally's is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Zen Mode, Zero to Hero, or already matches the target. Fails if both the user and its ally's Ability already matches the target, or if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Flower Gift, Forecast, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Hunger Switch, Ice Face, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Neutralizing Gas, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Power of Alchemy, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, Receiver, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Trace, Wonder Guard, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.
Doodle.shortDesc: User and ally's Abilities become target's Ability.

Doom Desire.name: Doom Desire
Doom Desire.desc: Deals damage two turns after this move is used. At the end of that turn, the damage is calculated at that time and dealt to the Pokemon at the position the target had when the move was used. If the user is no longer active at the time, damage is calculated based on the user's natural Special Attack stat, types, and level, with no boosts from its held item or Ability. Fails if this move or Future Sight is already in effect for the target's position.
Doom Desire.shortDesc: Hits two turns after being used.

Double-Edge.name: Double-Edge
Double-Edge.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

Double Hit.name: Double Hit
Double Hit.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

Double Iron Bash.name: Double Iron Bash
Double Iron Bash.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Double Iron Bash.shortDesc: Hits twice. 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Double Kick.name: Double Kick
Double Kick.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

Double Shock.name: Double Shock
Double Shock.desc: Fails unless the user is an Electric type. If this move is successful and the user is not Terastallized, the user's Electric type becomes typeless as long as it remains active.
Double Shock.shortDesc: User's Electric type: typeless; must be Electric.

Double Slap.name: Double Slap
Double Slap.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

Double Team.name: Double Team
Double Team.desc: Raises the user's evasiveness by 1 stage.

Draco Meteor.name: Draco Meteor
Draco Meteor.desc: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
Draco Meteor.shortDesc: Lowers the user's Sp. Atk by 2.

Dragon Ascent.name: Dragon Ascent
Dragon Ascent.desc: Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.
Dragon Ascent.shortDesc: Lowers the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 1.

Dragon Breath.name: Dragon Breath
Dragon Breath.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Dragon Dance.name: Dragon Dance
Dragon Dance.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by 1 stage.
Dragon Dance.shortDesc: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by 1.

Dragon Darts.name: Dragon Darts
Dragon Darts.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. In Double Battles, this move attempts to hit the targeted Pokemon and its ally once each. If hitting one of these Pokemon would be prevented by immunity, protection, semi-invulnerability, an Ability, or accuracy, it attempts to hit the other Pokemon twice instead. If this move is redirected, it hits that target twice.
Dragon Darts.shortDesc: Hits twice. Doubles: Tries to hit each foe once.

Dragon Energy.name: Dragon Energy
Dragon Energy.desc: Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.
Dragon Energy.shortDesc: Less power as user's HP decreases. Hits foe(s).

Dragon Rage.name: Dragon Rage
Dragon Rage.desc: Deals 40 HP of damage to the target.
Dragon Rage.shortDesc: Deals 40 HP of damage to the target.

Dragon Rush.name: Dragon Rush
Dragon Rush.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
Dragon Rush.shortDesc: 20% chance to make the target flinch.

Dragon Tail.name: Dragon Tail
Dragon Tail.desc: If both the user and the target have not fainted, the target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. This effect fails if the target used Ingrain previously, has the Suction Cups Ability, or this move hit a substitute.
Dragon Tail.shortDesc: Forces the target to switch to a random ally.

Draining Kiss.name: Draining Kiss
Draining Kiss.desc: The user recovers 3/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
Draining Kiss.shortDesc: User recovers 75% of the damage dealt.

Drain Punch.name: Drain Punch
Drain Punch.desc: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
Drain Punch.shortDesc: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

Dream Eater.name: Dream Eater
Dream Eater.desc: The target is unaffected by this move unless it is asleep. The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
Dream Eater.shortDesc: User gains 1/2 HP inflicted. Sleeping target only.

Drill Run.name: Drill Run
Drill Run.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

Drum Beating.name: Drum Beating
Drum Beating.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
Drum Beating.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1.

Dual Chop.name: Dual Chop
Dual Chop.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

Dual Wingbeat.name: Dual Wingbeat
Dual Wingbeat.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

Dynamic Punch.name: Dynamic Punch
Dynamic Punch.desc: Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.

Earth Power.name: Earth Power
Earth Power.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Earth Power.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.desc: Damage doubles if the target is using Dig.
Earthquake.shortDesc: Hits adjacent Pokemon. Double damage on Dig.

Echoed Voice.name: Echoed Voice
Echoed Voice.desc: For every consecutive turn that this move is used by at least one Pokemon, this move's power is multiplied by the number of turns to pass, but not more than 5.
Echoed Voice.shortDesc: Power increases when used on consecutive turns.

Eerie Impulse.name: Eerie Impulse
Eerie Impulse.desc: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 2 stages.
Eerie Impulse.shortDesc: Lowers the target's Sp. Atk by 2.

Eerie Spell.name: Eerie Spell
Eerie Spell.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the target loses 3 PP from its last move.
Eerie Spell.shortDesc: Removes 3 PP from the target's last move.

Electric Terrain.name: Electric Terrain
Electric Terrain.desc: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Electric Terrain. During the effect, the power of Electric-type attacks made by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.3 and grounded Pokemon cannot fall asleep; Pokemon already asleep do not wake up. Grounded Pokemon cannot become affected by Yawn or fall asleep from its effect. Camouflage transforms the user into an Electric type, Nature Power becomes Thunderbolt, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to cause paralysis. Fails if the current terrain is Electric Terrain.

Electrify.name: Electrify
Electrify.desc: Causes the target's move to become Electric type this turn. Among effects that can change a move's type, this effect happens last. Fails if the target already moved this turn.
Electrify.shortDesc: Changes the target's move to Electric this turn.

Electro Ball.name: Electro Ball
Electro Ball.desc: The power of this move depends on (user's current Speed / target's current Speed), rounded down. Power is equal to 150 if the result is 4 or more, 120 if 3, 80 if 2, 60 if 1, 40 if less than 1. If the target's current Speed is 0, this move's power is 40.
Electro Ball.shortDesc: More power the faster the user is than the target.

Electro Drift.name: Electro Drift
Electro Drift.desc: Damage is multiplied by 1.3333 if this move is super effective against the target.

Electroweb.name: Electroweb
Electroweb.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
Electroweb.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the foe(s) Speed by 1.

Embargo.name: Embargo
Embargo.desc: For 5 turns, the target's held item has no effect. An item's effect of causing forme changes is unaffected, but any other effects from such items are negated. During the effect, Fling and Natural Gift are prevented from being used by the target. Items thrown at the target with Fling will still activate for it. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain unable to use items.
Embargo.shortDesc: For 5 turns, the target's item has no effect.

Ember.name: Ember
Ember.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Encore.name: Encore
Encore.desc: For its next 3 turns, the target is forced to repeat its last move used. If the affected move runs out of PP, the effect ends. Fails if the target is already under this effect, if it has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if the move is Assist, Blazing Torque, Combat Torque, Copycat, Dynamax Cannon, Encore, Magical Torque, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Noxious Torque, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Transform, or Wicked Torque.
Encore.shortDesc: Target repeats its last move for its next 3 turns.

Endeavor.name: Endeavor
Endeavor.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to (target's current HP - user's current HP). The target is unaffected if its current HP is less than or equal to the user's current HP.
Endeavor.shortDesc: Lowers the target's HP to the user's HP.

Endure.name: Endure
Endure.desc: The user will survive attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn with at least 1 HP. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.
Endure.shortDesc: User survives attacks this turn with at least 1 HP.

Energy Ball.name: Energy Ball
Energy Ball.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Energy Ball.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

Entrainment.name: Entrainment
Entrainment.desc: Causes the target's Ability to become the same as the user's. Fails if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Truant, Zen Mode, Zero to Hero, or the same Ability as the user, or if the user's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Flower Gift, Forecast, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Hunger Switch, Ice Face, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Neutralizing Gas, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Power of Alchemy, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, Receiver, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Trace, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.
Entrainment.shortDesc: The target's Ability changes to match the user's.

Eruption.name: Eruption
Eruption.desc: Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.
Eruption.shortDesc: Less power as user's HP decreases. Hits foe(s).

Esper Wing.name: Esper Wing
Esper Wing.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage and a higher chance for a critical hit.
Esper Wing.shortDesc: 100% chance to raise user Speed by 1. High crit.

Eternabeam.name: Eternabeam
Eternabeam.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.

Expanding Force.name: Expanding Force
Expanding Force.desc: If the current terrain is Psychic Terrain and the user is grounded, this move hits all opposing Pokemon and has its power multiplied by 1.5.
Expanding Force.shortDesc: User on Psychic Terrain: 1.5x power, hits foes.

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.desc: The user faints after using this move, even if this move fails for having no target. This move is prevented from executing if any active Pokemon has the Damp Ability.
Explosion.shortDesc: Hits adjacent Pokemon. The user faints.

Extrasensory.name: Extrasensory
Extrasensory.desc: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
Extrasensory.shortDesc: 10% chance to make the target flinch.

Extreme Evoboost.name: Extreme Evoboost
Extreme Evoboost.desc: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 2 stages.
Extreme Evoboost.shortDesc: Raises user's Atk, Def, SpA, SpD, and Spe by 2.

Facade.name: Facade
Facade.desc: Power doubles if the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned. The physical damage halving effect from the user's burn is ignored.
Facade.shortDesc: Power doubles if user is burn/poison/paralyzed.

Fairy Lock.name: Fairy Lock
Fairy Lock.desc: Prevents all active Pokemon from switching next turn. A Pokemon can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. Fails if the effect is already active.
Fairy Lock.shortDesc: Prevents all Pokemon from switching next turn.

Fake Out.name: Fake Out
Fake Out.desc: Has a 100% chance to make the target flinch. Fails unless it is the user's first turn on the field.
Fake Out.shortDesc: Hits first. First turn out only. 100% flinch chance.

Fake Tears.name: Fake Tears
Fake Tears.desc: Lowers the target's Special Defense by 2 stages.
Fake Tears.shortDesc: Lowers the target's Sp. Def by 2.

False Surrender.name: False Surrender
False Surrender.desc: This move does not check accuracy.
False Surrender.shortDesc: This move does not check accuracy.

False Swipe.name: False Swipe
False Swipe.desc: Leaves the target with at least 1 HP.
False Swipe.shortDesc: Always leaves the target with at least 1 HP.

Feather Dance.name: Feather Dance
Feather Dance.desc: Lowers the target's Attack by 2 stages.

Feint.name: Feint
Feint.desc: If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally.
Feint.shortDesc: Nullifies Detect, Protect, and Quick/Wide Guard.

Feint Attack.name: Feint Attack
Feint Attack.desc: This move does not check accuracy.
Feint Attack.shortDesc: This move does not check accuracy.

Fell Stinger.name: Fell Stinger
Fell Stinger.desc: Raises the user's Attack by 3 stages if this move knocks out the target.
Fell Stinger.shortDesc: Raises user's Attack by 3 if this KOes the target.

Fiery Dance.name: Fiery Dance
Fiery Dance.desc: Has a 50% chance to raise the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.
Fiery Dance.shortDesc: 50% chance to raise the user's Sp. Atk by 1.

Fiery Wrath.name: Fiery Wrath
Fiery Wrath.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
Fiery Wrath.shortDesc: 20% chance to make the foe(s) flinch.

Fillet Away.name: Fillet Away
Fillet Away.desc: Raises the user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 2 stages in exchange for the user losing 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down. Fails if the user would faint or if its Attack, Special Attack, and Speed stat stages would not change.
Fillet Away.shortDesc: +2 Attack, Sp. Atk, Speed for 1/2 user's max HP.

Final Gambit.name: Final Gambit
Final Gambit.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the user's current HP. If this move is successful, the user faints.
Final Gambit.shortDesc: Does damage equal to the user's HP. User faints.

Fire Blast.name: Fire Blast
Fire Blast.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Fire Fang.name: Fire Fang
Fire Fang.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.
Fire Fang.shortDesc: 10% chance to burn. 10% chance to flinch.

Fire Lash.name: Fire Lash
Fire Lash.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Fire Lash.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

Fire Pledge.name: Fire Pledge
Fire Pledge.desc: If one of the user's allies chose to use Grass Pledge or Water Pledge this turn and has not moved yet, it takes its turn immediately after the user and the user's move does nothing. If combined with Grass Pledge, the ally uses Fire Pledge with 150 power and a sea of fire appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which causes damage to non-Fire types equal to 1/8 of their maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect, including the last turn. If combined with Water Pledge, the ally uses Water Pledge with 150 power and a rainbow appears on the user's side for 4 turns, which doubles secondary effect chances and stacks with the Serene Grace Ability, except effects that cause flinching can only have their chance doubled once. When used as a combined move, this move gains STAB no matter what the user's type is. This move does not consume the user's Fire Gem.
Fire Pledge.shortDesc: Use with Grass or Water Pledge for added effect.

Fire Punch.name: Fire Punch
Fire Punch.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Fire Spin.name: Fire Spin
Fire Spin.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
Fire Spin.shortDesc: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

First Impression.name: First Impression
First Impression.desc: Fails unless it is the user's first turn on the field.
First Impression.shortDesc: Hits first. First turn out only.

Fishious Rend.name: Fishious Rend
Fishious Rend.desc: Power doubles if the user moves before the target.
Fishious Rend.shortDesc: Power doubles if user moves before the target.

Fissure.name: Fissure
Fissure.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + 30)%, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.
Fissure.shortDesc: OHKOs the target. Fails if user is a lower level.

Flail.name: Flail
Flail.desc: The power of this move is 20 if X is 33 to 48, 40 if X is 17 to 32, 80 if X is 10 to 16, 100 if X is 5 to 9, 150 if X is 2 to 4, and 200 if X is 0 or 1, where X is equal to (user's current HP * 48 / user's maximum HP), rounded down.
Flail.shortDesc: More power the less HP the user has left.

Flame Burst.name: Flame Burst
Flame Burst.desc: If this move is successful, the target's ally loses 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, unless it has the Magic Guard Ability.
Flame Burst.shortDesc: Damages Pokemon next to the target as well.

Flame Charge.name: Flame Charge
Flame Charge.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage.
Flame Charge.shortDesc: 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1.

Flame Wheel.name: Flame Wheel
Flame Wheel.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
Flame Wheel.shortDesc: 10% chance to burn the target. Thaws user.

Flamethrower.name: Flamethrower
Flamethrower.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Flare Blitz.name: Flare Blitz
Flare Blitz.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target. If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
Flare Blitz.shortDesc: Has 33% recoil. 10% chance to burn. Thaws user.

Flash.name: Flash
Flash.desc: Lowers the target's accuracy by 1 stage.

Flash Cannon.name: Flash Cannon
Flash Cannon.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Flash Cannon.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

Flatter.name: Flatter
Flatter.desc: Raises the target's Special Attack by 1 stage and confuses it.
Flatter.shortDesc: Raises the target's Sp. Atk by 1 and confuses it.

Fleur Cannon.name: Fleur Cannon
Fleur Cannon.desc: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
Fleur Cannon.shortDesc: Lowers the user's Sp. Atk by 2.

Fling.name: Fling
Fling.desc: The power of this move is based on the user's held item. The held item is lost and it activates for the target if applicable. If there is no target or the target avoids this move by protecting itself, the user's held item is still lost. The user can regain a thrown item with Recycle or the Harvest Ability. Fails if the user has no held item, if the held item cannot be thrown, if the user is under the effect of Embargo or Magic Room, or if the user has the Klutz Ability.
Fling.shortDesc: Flings the user's item at the target. Power varies.

Flip Turn.name: Flip Turn
Flip Turn.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.
Flip Turn.shortDesc: User switches out after damaging the target.

Floaty Fall.name: Floaty Fall
Floaty Fall.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Floaty Fall.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Floral Healing.name: Floral Healing
Floral Healing.desc: The target restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up. If the terrain is Grassy Terrain, the target instead restores 2/3 of its maximum HP, rounded half down.
Floral Healing.shortDesc: Heals the target by 50% of its max HP.

Flower Shield.name: Flower Shield
Flower Shield.desc: Raises the Defense of all active Grass-type Pokemon by 1 stage. Fails if there are no active Grass-type Pokemon.
Flower Shield.shortDesc: Raises Defense by 1 of all active Grass types.

Flower Trick.name: Flower Trick
Flower Trick.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities. This move does not check accuracy.
Flower Trick.shortDesc: Always results in a critical hit; no accuracy check.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Gust, Hurricane, Sky Uppercut, Smack Down, Thousand Arrows, Thunder, and Twister, and Gust and Twister have doubled power when used against it. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
Fly.shortDesc: Flies up on first turn, then strikes the next turn.

Flying Press.name: Flying Press
Flying Press.desc: This move combines Flying in its type effectiveness against the target. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
Flying Press.shortDesc: Combines Flying in its type effectiveness.

Focus Blast.name: Focus Blast
Focus Blast.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.
Focus Blast.shortDesc: 10% chance to lower the target's Sp. Def by 1.

Focus Energy.name: Focus Energy
Focus Energy.desc: Raises the user's chance for a critical hit by 2 stages. Fails if the user already has the effect. Baton Pass can be used to transfer this effect to an ally.
Focus Energy.shortDesc: Raises the user's critical hit ratio by 2.

Focus Punch.name: Focus Punch
Focus Punch.desc: The user loses its focus and does nothing if it is hit by a damaging attack this turn before it can execute the move.
Focus Punch.shortDesc: Fails if the user takes damage before it hits.

Follow Me.name: Follow Me
Follow Me.desc: Until the end of the turn, all single-target attacks from the opposing side are redirected to the user. Such attacks are redirected to the user before they can be reflected by Magic Coat or the Magic Bounce Ability, or drawn in by the Lightning Rod or Storm Drain Abilities. Fails if it is not a Double Battle or Battle Royal. This effect is ignored while the user is under the effect of Sky Drop.
Follow Me.shortDesc: The foes' moves target the user on the turn used.

Force Palm.name: Force Palm
Force Palm.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Foresight.name: Foresight
Foresight.desc: As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it if it is greater than 0, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type. Fails if the target is already affected, or affected by Miracle Eye or Odor Sleuth.
Foresight.shortDesc: Fighting, Normal hit Ghost. Evasiveness ignored.

Forest's Curse.name: Forest's Curse
Forest's Curse.desc: Causes the Grass type to be added to the target, effectively making it have two or three types. Fails if the target is already a Grass type. If Trick-or-Treat adds a type to the target, it replaces the type added by this move and vice versa.
Forest's Curse.shortDesc: Adds Grass to the target's type(s).

Foul Play.name: Foul Play
Foul Play.desc: Damage is calculated using the target's Attack stat, including stat stage changes. The user's Ability, item, and burn are used as normal.
Foul Play.shortDesc: Uses target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

Freeze-Dry.name: Freeze-Dry
Freeze-Dry.desc: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target. This move's type effectiveness against Water is changed to be super effective no matter what this move's type is.
Freeze-Dry.shortDesc: 10% chance to freeze. Super effective on Water.

Freeze Shock.name: Freeze Shock
Freeze Shock.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

Freezing Glare.name: Freezing Glare
Freezing Glare.desc: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

Freezy Frost.name: Freezy Frost
Freezy Frost.desc: Resets the stat stages of all active Pokemon to 0.

Frenzy Plant.name: Frenzy Plant
Frenzy Plant.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.

Frost Breath.name: Frost Breath
Frost Breath.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.
Frost Breath.shortDesc: Always results in a critical hit.

Frustration.name: Frustration
Frustration.desc: Power is equal to the greater of ((255 - user's Happiness) * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.

Fury Attack.name: Fury Attack
Fury Attack.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

Fury Cutter.name: Fury Cutter
Fury Cutter.desc: Power doubles with each successful hit, up to a maximum of 160 power. The power is reset if this move misses or another move is used.
Fury Cutter.shortDesc: Power doubles with each hit, up to 160.

Fury Swipes.name: Fury Swipes
Fury Swipes.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

Fusion Bolt.name: Fusion Bolt
Fusion Bolt.desc: Power doubles if the last move used by any Pokemon this turn was Fusion Flare.
Fusion Bolt.shortDesc: Power doubles if used after Fusion Flare this turn.

Fusion Flare.name: Fusion Flare
Fusion Flare.desc: Power doubles if the last move used by any Pokemon this turn was Fusion Bolt.
Fusion Flare.shortDesc: Power doubles if used after Fusion Bolt this turn.

Future Sight.name: Future Sight
Future Sight.desc: Deals damage two turns after this move is used. At the end of that turn, the damage is calculated at that time and dealt to the Pokemon at the position the target had when the move was used. If the user is no longer active at the time, damage is calculated based on the user's natural Special Attack stat, types, and level, with no boosts from its held item or Ability. Fails if this move or Doom Desire is already in effect for the target's position.
Future Sight.shortDesc: Hits two turns after being used.

Gastro Acid.name: Gastro Acid
Gastro Acid.desc: Causes the target's Ability to be rendered ineffective as long as it remains active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under this effect. If the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero, this move fails, and receiving the effect through Baton Pass ends the effect immediately.

Gear Grind.name: Gear Grind
Gear Grind.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

Gear Up.name: Gear Up
Gear Up.desc: Raises the Attack and Special Attack of Pokemon on the user's side with the Plus or Minus Abilities by 1 stage.
Gear Up.shortDesc: Raises Atk, Sp. Atk of allies with Plus/Minus by 1.

Genesis Supernova.name: Genesis Supernova
Genesis Supernova.desc: If this move is successful, the terrain becomes Psychic Terrain.

Geomancy.name: Geomancy
Geomancy.desc: Raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 2 stages. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.
Geomancy.shortDesc: Charges, then raises SpA, SpD, Spe by 2 turn 2.

Giga Drain.name: Giga Drain
Giga Drain.desc: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
Giga Drain.shortDesc: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

Giga Impact.name: Giga Impact
Giga Impact.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.

Gigaton Hammer.name: Gigaton Hammer
Gigaton Hammer.desc: Cannot be used twice in a row.
Gigaton Hammer.shortDesc: Cannot be used twice in a row.

Gigavolt Havoc.name: Gigavolt Havoc
Gigavolt Havoc.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.
Gigavolt Havoc.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

Glacial Lance.name: Glacial Lance
Glacial Lance.shortDesc: No additional effect. Hits adjacent foes.

Glaciate.name: Glaciate
Glaciate.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
Glaciate.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the foe(s) Speed by 1.

Glaive Rush.name: Glaive Rush
Glaive Rush.desc: If this move is successful, moves targeted at the user deal double damage and do not check accuracy until the user's next turn.
Glaive Rush.shortDesc: User takes sure-hit 2x damage until its next turn.

Glitzy Glow.name: Glitzy Glow
Glitzy Glow.desc: This move summons Light Screen for 5 turns upon use.

G-Max Befuddle.name: G-Max Befuddle
G-Max Befuddle.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side either falls asleep, becomes poisoned, or becomes paralyzed, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Befuddle.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: slp or psn or par.

G-Max Cannonade.name: G-Max Cannonade
G-Max Cannonade.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, for 4 turns each non-Water-type Pokemon on the opposing side takes damage equal to 1/6 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect, including the last turn.
G-Max Cannonade.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: -1/6 HP, 4 turns.

G-Max Centiferno.name: G-Max Centiferno
G-Max Centiferno.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side is prevented from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw), even if they have a substitute. Causes damage equal to 1/8 of their maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. They can still switch out if they are holding Shed Shell or use Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends for a target if it leaves the field, or if it uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
G-Max Centiferno.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: bound 4-5 turns.

G-Max Chi Strike.name: G-Max Chi Strike
G-Max Chi Strike.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the user's side has their critical hit ratio raised by 1 stage, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Chi Strike.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Allies: Crit Ratio +1.

G-Max Cuddle.name: G-Max Cuddle
G-Max Cuddle.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side becomes infatuated, even if they have a substitute. This effect does not happen for a target if both it and the user are the same gender, if either is genderless, or if the target is already infatuated.
G-Max Cuddle.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: infatuated.

G-Max Depletion.name: G-Max Depletion
G-Max Depletion.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side loses 2 PP from its last move used, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Depletion.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: last move -2 PP.

G-Max Drum Solo.name: G-Max Drum Solo
G-Max Drum Solo.desc: Power is 160 regardless of the base move's Max Move power. This move and its effects ignore the Abilities of other Pokemon.

G-Max Finale.name: G-Max Finale
G-Max Finale.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the user's side restores 1/6 of its current maximum HP, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Finale.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Allies: +1/6 max HP.

G-Max Fireball.name: G-Max Fireball
G-Max Fireball.desc: Power is 160 regardless of the base move's Max Move power. This move and its effects ignore the Abilities of other Pokemon.

G-Max Foam Burst.name: G-Max Foam Burst
G-Max Foam Burst.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, the Speed of each Pokemon on the opposing side is lowered by 2 stages, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Foam Burst.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: -2 Speed.

G-Max Gold Rush.name: G-Max Gold Rush
G-Max Gold Rush.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side becomes confused, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Gold Rush.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: confused.

G-Max Gravitas.name: G-Max Gravitas
G-Max Gravitas.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, the effect of Gravity begins.
G-Max Gravitas.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Starts Gravity.

G-Max Hydrosnipe.name: G-Max Hydrosnipe
G-Max Hydrosnipe.desc: Power is 160 regardless of the base move's Max Move power. This move and its effects ignore the Abilities of other Pokemon.

G-Max Malodor.name: G-Max Malodor
G-Max Malodor.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side becomes poisoned, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Malodor.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: poisoned.

G-Max Meltdown.name: G-Max Meltdown
G-Max Meltdown.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, the effect of Torment begins for each Pokemon on the opposing side, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Meltdown.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: Tormented.

G-Max One Blow.name: G-Max One Blow
G-Max One Blow.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. This move bypasses all protection effects, including Max Guard.
G-Max One Blow.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Bypasses Max Guard.

G-Max Rapid Flow.name: G-Max Rapid Flow
G-Max Rapid Flow.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. This move bypasses all protection effects, including Max Guard.
G-Max Rapid Flow.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Bypasses Max Guard.

G-Max Replenish.name: G-Max Replenish
G-Max Replenish.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, there is a 50% chance every Pokemon on the user's side has its Berry restored, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Replenish.shortDesc: Base move affects power. 50% restores Berries.

G-Max Resonance.name: G-Max Resonance
G-Max Resonance.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, the effect of Aurora Veil begins on the user's side.
G-Max Resonance.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Allies: Aurora Veil.

G-Max Sandblast.name: G-Max Sandblast
G-Max Sandblast.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side is prevented from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw), even if they have a substitute. Causes damage equal to 1/8 of their maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. They can still switch out if they are holding Shed Shell or use Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends for a target if it leaves the field, or if it uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
G-Max Sandblast.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: bound 4-5 turns.

G-Max Smite.name: G-Max Smite
G-Max Smite.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side becomes confused, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Smite.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: confused.

G-Max Snooze.name: G-Max Snooze
G-Max Snooze.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, there is a 50% chance the effect of Yawn begins on the target, even if it has a substitute.
G-Max Snooze.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Target: 50% Yawn.

G-Max Steelsurge.name: G-Max Steelsurge
G-Max Steelsurge.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, it sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in. Foes lose 1/32, 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2 of their maximum HP, rounded down, based on their weakness to the Steel type; 0.25x, 0.5x, neutral, 2x, or 4x, respectively. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.
G-Max Steelsurge.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: Steel hazard.

G-Max Stonesurge.name: G-Max Stonesurge
G-Max Stonesurge.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, it sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in. Foes lose 1/32, 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2 of their maximum HP, rounded down, based on their weakness to the Rock type; 0.25x, 0.5x, neutral, 2x, or 4x, respectively. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.
G-Max Stonesurge.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: Stealth Rock.

G-Max Stun Shock.name: G-Max Stun Shock
G-Max Stun Shock.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side either becomes poisoned or paralyzed, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Stun Shock.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: psn or par.

G-Max Sweetness.name: G-Max Sweetness
G-Max Sweetness.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the user's side has its status condition cured, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Sweetness.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Allies: status cured.

G-Max Tartness.name: G-Max Tartness
G-Max Tartness.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, the evasiveness of each Pokemon on the opposing side is lowered by 1 stage, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Tartness.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: -1 evasiveness.

G-Max Terror.name: G-Max Terror
G-Max Terror.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side is prevented from switching out, even if they have a substitute. They can still switch out if they are holding Shed Shell or use Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If a target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.
G-Max Terror.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: trapped.

G-Max Vine Lash.name: G-Max Vine Lash
G-Max Vine Lash.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, for 4 turns each non-Grass-type Pokemon on the opposing side takes damage equal to 1/6 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect, including the last turn.
G-Max Vine Lash.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: -1/6 HP, 4 turns.

G-Max Volcalith.name: G-Max Volcalith
G-Max Volcalith.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, for 4 turns each non-Rock-type Pokemon on the opposing side takes damage equal to 1/6 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect, including the last turn.
G-Max Volcalith.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: -1/6 HP, 4 turns.

G-Max Volt Crash.name: G-Max Volt Crash
G-Max Volt Crash.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, each Pokemon on the opposing side becomes paralyzed, even if they have a substitute.
G-Max Volt Crash.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: paralyzed.

G-Max Wildfire.name: G-Max Wildfire
G-Max Wildfire.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, for 4 turns each non-Fire-type Pokemon on the opposing side takes damage equal to 1/6 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect, including the last turn.
G-Max Wildfire.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Foes: -1/6 HP, 4 turns.

G-Max Wind Rage.name: G-Max Wind Rage
G-Max Wind Rage.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Max Move power. If this move is successful, the effects of Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain, and Psychic Terrain end, the effects of Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil, Safeguard, Mist, G-Max Steelsurge, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the target's side, and the effects of G-Max Steelsurge, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the user's side.
G-Max Wind Rage.shortDesc: Base move affects power. Ends Terrain, hazards.

Grass Knot.name: Grass Knot
Grass Knot.desc: This move's power is 20 if the target weighs less than 10 kg, 40 if less than 25 kg, 60 if less than 50 kg, 80 if less than 100 kg, 100 if less than 200 kg, and 120 if greater than or equal to 200 kg.
Grass Knot.shortDesc: More power the heavier the target.

Grass Pledge.name: Grass Pledge
Grass Pledge.desc: If one of the user's allies chose to use Fire Pledge or Water Pledge this turn and has not moved yet, it takes its turn immediately after the user and the user's move does nothing. If combined with Fire Pledge, the ally uses Fire Pledge with 150 power and a sea of fire appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which causes damage to non-Fire types equal to 1/8 of their maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect, including the last turn. If combined with Water Pledge, the ally uses Grass Pledge with 150 power and a swamp appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which quarters the Speed of each Pokemon on that side. When used as a combined move, this move gains STAB no matter what the user's type is. This move does not consume the user's Grass Gem.
Grass Pledge.shortDesc: Use with Fire or Water Pledge for added effect.

Grass Whistle.name: Grass Whistle
Grass Whistle.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep.
Grass Whistle.shortDesc: Causes the target to fall asleep.

Grassy Glide.name: Grassy Glide
Grassy Glide.desc: If the current terrain is Grassy Terrain and the user is grounded, this move has its priority increased by 1.

Grassy Terrain.name: Grassy Terrain
Grassy Terrain.desc: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Grassy Terrain. During the effect, the power of Grass-type attacks used by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.3, the power of Bulldoze, Earthquake, and Magnitude used against grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 0.5, and grounded Pokemon have 1/16 of their maximum HP, rounded down, restored at the end of each turn, including the last turn. Camouflage transforms the user into a Grass type, Nature Power becomes Energy Ball, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to cause sleep. Fails if the current terrain is Grassy Terrain.

Grav Apple.name: Grav Apple
Grav Apple.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage. Power is multiplied by 1.5 during Gravity's effect.

Gravity.name: Gravity
Gravity.desc: For 5 turns, the evasiveness of all active Pokemon is multiplied by 0.6. At the time of use, Bounce, Fly, Magnet Rise, Sky Drop, and Telekinesis end immediately for all active Pokemon. During the effect, Bounce, Fly, Flying Press, High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, Magnet Rise, Sky Drop, Splash, and Telekinesis are prevented from being used by all active Pokemon. Ground-type attacks, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Sticky Web, and the Arena Trap Ability can affect Flying types or Pokemon with the Levitate Ability. Fails if this move is already in effect.

Growl.name: Growl
Growl.desc: Lowers the target's Attack by 1 stage.

Growth.name: Growth
Growth.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage. If the weather is Sunny Day or Desolate Land, this move raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella, this move will only raise the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage, even if the weather is Sunny Day or Desolate Land.
Growth.shortDesc: Raises user's Attack and Sp. Atk by 1; 2 in Sun.

Grudge.name: Grudge
Grudge.desc: Until the user's next turn, if an opposing Pokemon's attack knocks the user out, that move loses all its remaining PP.
Grudge.shortDesc: If the user faints, the attack used loses all its PP.

Guardian of Alola.name: Guardian of Alola
Guardian of Alola.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to 3/4 of its current HP, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
Guardian of Alola.shortDesc: Does damage equal to 3/4 target's current HP.

Guard Split.name: Guard Split
Guard Split.desc: The user and the target have their Defense and Special Defense stats set to be equal to the average of the user and the target's Defense and Special Defense stats, respectively, rounded down. Stat stage changes are unaffected.
Guard Split.shortDesc: Averages Defense and Sp. Def stats with target.

Guard Swap.name: Guard Swap
Guard Swap.desc: The user swaps its Defense and Special Defense stat stage changes with the target.
Guard Swap.shortDesc: Swaps Defense and Sp. Def changes with target.

Guillotine.name: Guillotine
Guillotine.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + 30)%, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.
Guillotine.shortDesc: OHKOs the target. Fails if user is a lower level.

Gunk Shot.name: Gunk Shot
Gunk Shot.desc: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

Gust.name: Gust
Gust.desc: Power doubles if the target is using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop.
Gust.shortDesc: Power doubles during Bounce, Fly, and Sky Drop.

Gyro Ball.name: Gyro Ball
Gyro Ball.desc: Power is equal to (25 * target's current Speed / user's current Speed) + 1, rounded down, but not more than 150. If the user's current Speed is 0, this move's power is 1.
Gyro Ball.shortDesc: More power the slower the user than the target.

Hail.name: Hail
Hail.desc: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Hail. At the end of each turn except the last, all active Pokemon lose 1/16 of their maximum HP, rounded down, unless they are an Ice type or have the Ice Body, Magic Guard, Overcoat, or Snow Cloak Abilities. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Icy Rock. Fails if the current weather is Hail.

Hammer Arm.name: Hammer Arm
Hammer Arm.desc: Lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage.

Harden.name: Harden
Harden.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.

Haze.name: Haze
Haze.desc: Resets the stat stages of all active Pokemon to 0.

Headbutt.name: Headbutt
Headbutt.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Headbutt.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Head Charge.name: Head Charge
Head Charge.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

Headlong Rush.name: Headlong Rush
Headlong Rush.desc: Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.
Headlong Rush.shortDesc: Lowers the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 1.

Head Smash.name: Head Smash
Head Smash.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

Heal Bell.name: Heal Bell
Heal Bell.desc: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition. Active Pokemon with the Soundproof Ability are not cured, unless they are the user.
Heal Bell.shortDesc: Cures the user's party of all status conditions.

Heal Block.name: Heal Block
Heal Block.desc: For 5 turns, the target is prevented from restoring any HP as long as it remains active. During the effect, healing and draining moves are unusable, and Abilities and items that grant healing will not heal the user. If an affected Pokemon uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain unable to restore its HP. Pain Split and the Regenerator Ability are unaffected.
Heal Block.shortDesc: For 5 turns, the foe(s) is prevented from healing.

Healing Wish.name: Healing Wish
Healing Wish.desc: The user faints, and if the Pokemon brought out to replace it does not have full HP or has a non-volatile status condition, its HP is fully restored along with having any non-volatile status condition cured. The replacement is sent out at the end of the turn, and the healing happens before hazards take effect. This effect continues until a Pokemon that meets either of these conditions switches in at the user's position or gets swapped into the position with Ally Switch. Fails if the user is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party.
Healing Wish.shortDesc: User faints. Next hurt Pokemon is fully healed.

Heal Order.name: Heal Order
Heal Order.desc: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up.
Heal Order.shortDesc: Heals the user by 50% of its max HP.

Heal Pulse.name: Heal Pulse
Heal Pulse.desc: The target restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up. If the user has the Mega Launcher Ability, the target instead restores 3/4 of its maximum HP, rounded half down.
Heal Pulse.shortDesc: Heals the target by 50% of its max HP.

Heart Stamp.name: Heart Stamp
Heart Stamp.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Heart Stamp.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Heart Swap.name: Heart Swap
Heart Swap.desc: The user swaps all its stat stage changes with the target.
Heart Swap.shortDesc: Swaps all stat changes with target.

Heat Crash.name: Heat Crash
Heat Crash.desc: The power of this move depends on (user's weight / target's weight), rounded down. Power is equal to 120 if the result is 5 or more, 100 if 4, 80 if 3, 60 if 2, and 40 if 1 or less. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
Heat Crash.shortDesc: More power the heavier the user than the target.

Heat Wave.name: Heat Wave
Heat Wave.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Heavy Slam.name: Heavy Slam
Heavy Slam.desc: The power of this move depends on (user's weight / target's weight), rounded down. Power is equal to 120 if the result is 5 or more, 100 if 4, 80 if 3, 60 if 2, and 40 if 1 or less. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.
Heavy Slam.shortDesc: More power the heavier the user than the target.

Helping Hand.name: Helping Hand
Helping Hand.desc: The power of the target's attack this turn is multiplied by 1.5 (this effect is stackable). Fails if there is no ally adjacent to the user or if the ally already moved this turn, but does not fail if the ally is using a two-turn move.
Helping Hand.shortDesc: One adjacent ally's move power is 1.5x this turn.

Hex.name: Hex
Hex.desc: Power doubles if the target has a non-volatile status condition.
Hex.shortDesc: Power doubles if the target has a status ailment.

Hidden Power.name: Hidden Power
Hidden Power.desc: This move's type depends on the user's individual values (IVs), and can be any type but Fairy and Normal.
Hidden Power.shortDesc: Varies in type based on the user's IVs.

High Jump Kick.name: High Jump Kick
High Jump Kick.desc: If this attack is not successful, the user loses half of its maximum HP, rounded down, as crash damage. Pokemon with the Magic Guard Ability are unaffected by crash damage.
High Jump Kick.shortDesc: User is hurt by 50% of its max HP if it misses.

Hold Back.name: Hold Back
Hold Back.desc: Leaves the target with at least 1 HP.
Hold Back.shortDesc: Always leaves the target with at least 1 HP.

Hold Hands.name: Hold Hands
Hold Hands.desc: No competitive use. Fails if there is no ally adjacent to the user.

Hone Claws.name: Hone Claws
Hone Claws.desc: Raises the user's Attack and accuracy by 1 stage.
Hone Claws.shortDesc: Raises the user's Attack and accuracy by 1.

Horn Drill.name: Horn Drill
Horn Drill.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + 30)%, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.
Horn Drill.shortDesc: OHKOs the target. Fails if user is a lower level.

Horn Leech.name: Horn Leech
Horn Leech.desc: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.
Horn Leech.shortDesc: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

Howl.name: Howl
Howl.desc: Raises the Attack of the user and all allies 1 stage.
Howl.shortDesc: Raises the user's and ally's Attack by 1.

Hurricane.name: Hurricane
Hurricane.desc: Has a 30% chance to confuse the target. This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop. If the weather is Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, this move does not check accuracy. If the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, this move's accuracy is 50%. If this move is used against a Pokemon holding Utility Umbrella, this move's accuracy remains at 70%.
Hurricane.shortDesc: 30% chance to confuse target. Can't miss in rain.

Hydro Cannon.name: Hydro Cannon
Hydro Cannon.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.

Hydro Steam.name: Hydro Steam
Hydro Steam.desc: If the current weather is Sunny Day and the user is not holding Utility Umbrella, this move's damage is multiplied by 1.5 instead of halved for being Water type.
Hydro Steam.shortDesc: During Sunny Day: 1.5x damage instead of half.

Hydro Vortex.name: Hydro Vortex
Hydro Vortex.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.
Hydro Vortex.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

Hyper Beam.name: Hyper Beam
Hyper Beam.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.

Hyper Fang.name: Hyper Fang
Hyper Fang.desc: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
Hyper Fang.shortDesc: 10% chance to make the target flinch.

Hyperspace Fury.name: Hyperspace Fury
Hyperspace Fury.desc: Lowers the user's Defense by 1 stage. This move cannot be used successfully unless the user's current form, while considering Transform, is Hoopa Unbound. If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally.
Hyperspace Fury.shortDesc: Hoopa-U: Lowers user's Def by 1; breaks protect.

Hyperspace Hole.name: Hyperspace Hole
Hyperspace Hole.desc: If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally.
Hyperspace Hole.shortDesc: Breaks the target's protection for this turn.

Hyper Voice.name: Hyper Voice
Hyper Voice.shortDesc: No additional effect. Hits adjacent foes.

Hypnosis.name: Hypnosis
Hypnosis.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep.
Hypnosis.shortDesc: Causes the target to fall asleep.

Ice Ball.name: Ice Ball
Ice Ball.desc: If this move is successful, the user is locked into this move and cannot make another move until it misses, 5 turns have passed, or the attack cannot be used. Power doubles with each successful hit of this move and doubles again if Defense Curl was used previously by the user. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn.
Ice Ball.shortDesc: Power doubles with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

Ice Beam.name: Ice Beam
Ice Beam.desc: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

Ice Burn.name: Ice Burn
Ice Burn.desc: Has a 30% chance to burn the target. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

Ice Fang.name: Ice Fang
Ice Fang.desc: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.
Ice Fang.shortDesc: 10% chance to freeze. 10% chance to flinch.

Ice Hammer.name: Ice Hammer
Ice Hammer.desc: Lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage.

Ice Punch.name: Ice Punch
Ice Punch.desc: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

Ice Spinner.name: Ice Spinner
Ice Spinner.desc: Ends the effects of Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain, and Psychic Terrain.

Icicle Crash.name: Icicle Crash
Icicle Crash.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Icicle Crash.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Icicle Spear.name: Icicle Spear
Icicle Spear.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

Icy Wind.name: Icy Wind
Icy Wind.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.
Icy Wind.shortDesc: 100% chance to lower the foe(s) Speed by 1.

Imprison.name: Imprison
Imprison.desc: The user prevents all opposing Pokemon from using any moves that the user also knows as long as the user remains active.
Imprison.shortDesc: No foe can use any move known by the user.

Incinerate.name: Incinerate
Incinerate.desc: The target loses its held item if it is a Berry or a Gem. This move cannot cause Pokemon with the Sticky Hold Ability to lose their held item. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.

Infernal Parade.name: Infernal Parade
Infernal Parade.desc: Has a 30% chance to burn the target. Power doubles if the target has a non-volatile status condition.
Infernal Parade.shortDesc: 30% burn. 2x power if target is already statused.

Inferno.name: Inferno
Inferno.desc: Has a 100% chance to burn the target.

Inferno Overdrive.name: Inferno Overdrive
Inferno Overdrive.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.
Inferno Overdrive.shortDesc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

Infestation.name: Infestation
Infestation.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
Infestation.shortDesc: Traps and damages the target for 4-5 turns.

Ingrain.name: Ingrain
Ingrain.desc: The user has 1/16 of its maximum HP restored at the end of each turn, but it is prevented from switching out and other Pokemon cannot force the user to switch out. The user can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If the user leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped and still receive the healing effect. During the effect, the user can be hit normally by Ground-type attacks and be affected by Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and Sticky Web, even if the user is a Flying type or has the Levitate Ability.
Ingrain.shortDesc: Traps/grounds user; heals 1/16 max HP per turn.

Instruct.name: Instruct
Instruct.desc: The target immediately uses its last used move. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, if the target is preparing to use Beak Blast, Focus Punch, or Shell Trap, or if the move is Assist, Beak Blast, Belch, Bide, Blazing Torque, Celebrate, Chatter, Combat Torque, Copycat, Dynamax Cannon, Focus Punch, Hold Hands, Ice Ball, Instruct, King's Shield, Magical Torque, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Noxious Torque, Obstruct, Outrage, Petal Dance, Rollout, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Thrash, Transform, Uproar, Wicked Torque, any two-turn move, or any recharge move.
Instruct.shortDesc: The target immediately uses its last used move.

Ion Deluge.name: Ion Deluge
Ion Deluge.desc: Causes Normal-type moves to become Electric type this turn. The effect happens after other effects that change a move's type.
Ion Deluge.shortDesc: Normal moves become Electric type this turn.

Iron Defense.name: Iron Defense
Iron Defense.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

Iron Head.name: Iron Head
Iron Head.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
Iron Head.shortDesc: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Iron Tail.name: Iron Tail
Iron Tail.desc: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
Iron Tail.shortDesc: 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

Jaw Lock.name: Jaw Lock
Jaw Lock.desc: Prevents the user and the target from switching out. The user and the target can still switch out if either of them is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field.
Jaw Lock.shortDesc: Prevents both user and target from switching out.

Judgment.name: Judgment
Judgment.desc: This move's type depends on the user's held Plate.
Judgment.shortDesc: Type varies based on the held Plate.

Jump Kick.name: Jump Kick
Jump Kick.desc: If this attack is not successful, the user loses half of its maximum HP, rounded down, as crash damage. Pokemon with the Magic Guard Ability are unaffected by crash damage.
Jump Kick.shortDesc: User is hurt by 50% of its max HP if it misses.

Jungle Healing.name: Jungle Healing
Jungle Healing.desc: Each Pokemon on the user's side restores 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded half up, and has its status condition cured.
Jungle Healing.shortDesc: User and allies: healed 1/4 max HP, status cured.

Karate Chop.name: Karate Chop
Karate Chop.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

Kinesis.name: Kinesis
Kinesis.desc: Lowers the target's accuracy by 1 stage.

King's Shield.name: King's Shield
